page.title: 18Our school in the 30's
page.content: Mr.Toms came to this school in the 30's, when the boys & girls were separated in the playgrounds. The boys wore hobnail boots & caps, & the girls wore wool stockings. There were no school dinners,trips or parties & lessons were different to today's. Maths was mostly arithmetic, with times tables & long division. They did lots of History & Singing with the headmaster, who wrote a school song. They had to learn long poems & Bible passages,& girls did cookery, & boys did woodwork. The best at each subject were given prizes. Discipline was strict but fair. They played with tops, hoops, marbles & cigarette cards, & every week the boys would play football, & the girls played stoolball. Mr. Toms says his favourite lesson was singing.
